intro: Retanilla obcordata, commonly known as the broad-leafed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, well-drained soils. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Retanilla obcordata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms.
